meanings.definition: To break apart or disintegrate under the action of light.
meanings.sent1: The old painting started photodisintegrating when sunlight hit it.
meanings.sent2: The ice sculpture began photodisintegrating as the sun's rays touched it.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate bar was photodisintegrating in the hot car, turning into a gooey mess.
meanings.sent4: The fragile sandcastle photodisintegrated under the intense heat of the summer sun.
meanings.sent5: The ancient parchment was slowly photodisintegrating, fading away with each sunrise.

meanings.definition: The process of breaking down or decomposing due to exposure to light.
meanings.sent1: Photodisintegrating can be seen in old photographs left in direct sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The photodisintegrating of plastic under UV light is a common environmental concern.
meanings.sent3: The photodisintegrating of the fruit left on the windowsill created a fruity aroma.
meanings.sent4: The photodisintegrating of the cardboard box made it fragile and easy to tear.
meanings.sent5: The slow photodisintegrating of the fabric exposed to sunlight changed its color over time.
